com.btc.redg.generator

Class CodeGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.btc.redg.generator.CodeGenerator

  • public class CodeGenerator
extends Object
    The class that manages the templates and does all the code generation

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CodeGenerator()
      Creates a new code generator using the default 'templates.stg' template file
      CodeGenerator(String templateResource)
      Creates a new code generator using the passed template resource.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CodeGenerator

        public CodeGenerator()
        Creates a new code generator using the default 'templates.stg' template file

      • CodeGenerator

        public CodeGenerator(String templateResource)
        Creates a new code generator using the passed template resource. The template group file must include templates
        • mainClass(package, prefix, tables)
        • tableClass(package, className, columns, foreignKeys)
        There is no check build in, code generation will fail if these templates do not exist.
        Parameters:
        templateResource - the resource to use. Has to be a .stg template group file

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public void generate(List<TableModel> tables,
                     Path targetWithPkgFolders,
                     boolean enableVisualizationSupport)
        Generates the code for the passed TableModels and writes the output into the passed folder. Each TableModel results in two files (one for the main entity, one for the existing entity reference) and a "main" manager class is generated as well, which contains all the instantiation and management methods.
        Parameters:
        tables - The TableModels that code should be generated for.
        targetWithPkgFolders - The path pointing to the location the .java files should be places at.
        enableVisualizationSupport - If true, the RedG visualization features will be enabled for the generated code. This will result in a small performance hit and slightly more memory usage if activated.

      • generateCodeForTable

        public String generateCodeForTable(TableModel table,
                                   boolean enableVisualizationSupport)
        Generates a java code file that can later be used to generate SQL insert strings for the given extractor table. All the data are taken from the TableModel, which was filled by a TableExtractor (normally used by the MetadataExtractor)

        For each column in this table the generated class will contain a private variable holding the value and a builder method to set the value. Foreign key columns will be a reference to the generated class/object for that table and need to be passed via the constructor to ensure that foreign key constraints are met and inserts will be in the right order. Proper null-checks will be generated.

        Parameters:
        table - The extracted table model to generate code for
        enableVisualizationSupport - If true, the RedG visualization features will be enabled for the generated code. This will result in a small performance hit and slightly more memory usage if activated.
        Returns:
        The generated source code

      • generateExistingClassCodeForTable

        public String generateExistingClassCodeForTable(TableModel table)
        Generates the java code for the class representing a entity that is already in the database but needs to be referenced from entities that should be created by RedG.

        All the data are taken from the TableModel, which was filled by a TableExtractor (normally used by the MetadataExtractor)

        The generated class extends the class generated by generateCodeForTable(TableModel, boolean) and overwrites its methods, throwing UnsupportedOperationException for each field access except getting the value of the primary keys.

        Parameters:
        table - The extracted table model to generate code for
        Returns:
        The generated source code

      • generateMainClass

        public String generateMainClass(Collection<TableModel> tables,
                                boolean enableVisualizationSupport)
        Generates the main class used for creating the extractor objects and later generating the insert statements. For each passed table a appropriate creation method will be generated that will return the new object and internally add it to the list of objects that will be used to generate the insert strings
        Parameters:
        tables - All tables that should get a creation method in the main class
        enableVisualizationSupport - If true, the RedG visualization features will be enabled for the generated code. This will result in a small performance hit and slightly more memory usage if activated.
        Returns:
        The generated source code
